intro: Narthecium calyculatum var. pubens, commonly known as the pubescent wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in cool, humid conditions and is often found in association with other alpine and subalpine flora.
